radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is mildly distended and contains echogenic material with posterior shadowing consistent with cholelithiasis. No evidence of gallbladder wall thickening, gallbladder wall edema, or pericholecystic fluid. The liver is normal in echotexture with no focal liver lesions identified. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The common bile duct is normal measuring 3 mm. The visualized portions of the pancreas are normal; however, portions of the pancreatic body and tail are obscured by bowel gas and not fully seen. The right kidney is normal without hydronephrosis.
